00049 /*********************************************************************************************************//**

00055 }
00056 
00057 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00058  * @brief   This function handles Hard Fault exception.
00059  * @retval  None
00060  ************************************************************************************************************/
00061 void HardFault_Handler(void)
00062 {
00063   #if 1
00064 
00065   static vu32 gIsContinue = 0;
00066   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00067   /* For development FW, MCU run into the while loop when the hardfault occurred.                           */
00068   /* 1. Stack Checking                                                                                      */
00069   /*    When a hard fault exception occurs, MCU push following register into the stack (main or process     */
00070   /*    stack). Confirm R13(SP) value in the Register Window and typing it to the Memory Windows, you can   */
00071   /*    check following register, especially the PC value (indicate the last instruction before hard fault).*/
00072   /*    SP + 0x00    0x04    0x08    0x0C    0x10    0x14    0x18    0x1C                                   */
00073   /*           R0      R1      R2      R3     R12      LR      PC    xPSR                                   */
00074   while (gIsContinue == 0)
00075   {
00076   }
00077   /* 2. Step Out to Find the Clue                                                                           */
00078   /*    Change the variable "gIsContinue" to any other value than zero in a Local or Watch Window, then     */
00079   /*    step out the HardFault_Handler to reach the first instruction after the instruction which caused    */
00080   /*    the hard fault.                                                                                     */
00081   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00082 
00083   #else
00084 
00085   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00086   /* For production FW, you shall consider to reboot the system when hardfault occurred.                    */
00087   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00088   NVIC_SystemReset();
00089 
00090   #endif
00091 }
00092

00117 #define DEBUG_IO          (0)
00118 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00119  * @brief   This function handles UxARTn interrupt.
00120  * @retval  None
00121  ************************************************************************************************************/
00122 void HTCFG_UART_IRQHandler(void)
00123 {
00124   extern uc8  *gURTx_Ptr;
00125   extern vu32  gURTx_Length;
00126   extern u8   *gURRx_Ptr;
00127   extern vu32  gURRx_Length;
00128   extern vu32 gIsTxFinished;
00129 
00130 #if (DEBUG_IO == 1)
00131   #define DBG_IO1_LO()    HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED1)
00132   #define DBG_IO1_HI()    HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED1)
00133   #define DBG_IO2_LO()    HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED2)
00134   #define DBG_IO2_HI()    HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED2)
00135 #else
00136   #define DBG_IO1_LO(...)
00137   #define DBG_IO1_HI(...)
00138   #define DBG_IO2_LO(...)
00139   #define DBG_IO2_HI(...)
00140 #endif
00141 
00142   if (USART_GetFlagStatus(HTCFG_UART_PORT, USART_FLAG_RSADD))
00143   {
00144     extern vu32 guSlaveState;
00145     u8 uSlaveAddr;
00146 
00147     USART_ClearFlag(HTCFG_UART_PORT, USART_FLAG_RSADD);
00148     uSlaveAddr = USART_ReceiveData(HTCFG_UART_PORT);
00149 
00150     if (uSlaveAddr == HTCFG_RS485_SLAVE_ADDR)
00151     {
00152       USART_RxCmd(HTCFG_UART_PORT, ENABLE);
00153       guSlaveState = RS485_STATE_ADDRESSED;
00154     }
00155     else
00156     {
00157       #if 1
00158       /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00159          A data packet (Parity = 0) is required after received a unmatch address packet to receive the
00160          next address packet.
00161       */
00162       USART_RxCmd(HTCFG_UART_PORT, DISABLE);
00163       #else
00164       /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00165          Must reset USART IP if no data packet (Parity = 0) after received a unmatch address packet.
00166       */
00167       extern void UxART_Configuration(void);
00168       USART_DeInit(HTCFG_UART_PORT);
00169       UxART_Configuration();
00170       #endif
00171 
00172       guSlaveState = RS485_STATE_IDLE;
00173     }
00174   }
00175 
00176   /* Rx: Move data from UART to buffer                                                                      */
00177   if (USART_GetFlagStatus(HTCFG_UART_PORT, USART_FLAG_RXDR))
00178   {
00179     DBG_IO1_LO();
00180     gURRx_Ptr[gURRx_Length++] = USART_ReceiveData(HTCFG_UART_PORT);
00181     DBG_IO1_HI();
00182 
00183     #if 0
00184     if (gURRx_Length == 128)
00185     {
00186       while (1) {}; // Rx Buffer full
00187     }
00188     #endif
00189   }
00190 
00191   /* Tx, move data from buffer to UART                                                                      */
00192   if (USART_GetIntStatus(HTCFG_UART_PORT, USART_INT_TXDE) &&
00193       USART_GetFlagStatus(HTCFG_UART_PORT, USART_FLAG_TXDE))
00194   {
00195     DBG_IO2_LO();
00196     if (gURTx_Length > 0)
00197     {
00198       USART_SendData(HTCFG_UART_PORT, *gURTx_Ptr++);
00199       gURTx_Length--;
00200       if (gURTx_Length == 0)
00201       {
00202         USART_IntConfig(HTCFG_UART_PORT, USART_INT_TXDE, DISABLE);
00203       }
00204     }
00205     DBG_IO2_HI();
00206   }
00207 
00208   if (USART_GetIntStatus(HTCFG_UART_PORT, USART_INT_TXC) &&
00209       USART_GetFlagStatus(HTCFG_UART_PORT, USART_FLAG_TXC))
00210   {
00211     USART_IntConfig(HTCFG_UART_PORT, USART_INT_TXC, DISABLE);
00212     gIsTxFinished = TRUE;
00213   }
00214 }
00215
